subject: Re: [junit] How to test exceptions in java with junit
msgSnippet: In Junit 3.8 I use a style like (BTW Not everyone on this list will agree its worth testing this particular case - but its a simple example of the style):
messageBody:
In Junit 3.8 I use a style like (BTW Not everyone on this list will agree
its worth testing this particular case - but its a simple example of the
style):

public void testConstructionExceptions() {
try {
new RemoveElementOperation(null);
fail("new RemoveElementOperation - should've thrown an
IllegalArgumentException");
} catch (IllegalArgumentException iae) {// NOPMD
}
}

In Junit 4 - you just mark the test method with annotation saying that it
throws an exception of type XXXException - I don't know the details as I'm
on java 1.4.x for the forseeable future.

Details here: http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#tests_7

BTW Googling "junit test for exceptions" found both of these answers. Please
google before asking a question.

Cheers
Mark
